name: Hall Garth Golf And Country Club

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed with my wife and 4 year old on the night of the 4th June in Room 28, on arrival check in was efficient and completed with a smile.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - More attention to detail required

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we were allocated was in the main building and for a standard room was very spacious and in a good state of repair in general. There were a couple of issues with the room that need attention, filth windows (did not look like they had been cleaned for months or longer) and the grout and extractor fan in the bathroom both need a thorough clean. Other that those items the room was very pleasent and had a cumfy bed and flat screen tv.
reviews.title: A little Gem just off the A1

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Hotel has a nice spacious bar just outside of the reception (the stables) with friendly staff, we enjoyed a drink there which was reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Very Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The leisure club on site was also excellent with very friendly staff who made us very welcome, the girl on reception showed us around and went out of her way to get floats for my daughter to use in the pool. We enjoyed a couple of very nice hours using the pool area which was clean well maintained.
reviews.title: Hotel not as nice as expected but food very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Our experience in the restaraunt was a bit mixed at dinner - the service was quite slow, and the staff had forgotton to order my daughters meal, although this was quickly sorted out. The quality of the food when it arrived was high and even with the service issues we enjoyed our meal (the staff were friendly and helpfull but were clearly overstreached which was the problem) Breakfast was the same situation slow service, and clearing down of tables, the staff seemed stressed and had lost some of the humour and politeness that we had received the night before. Once the English breakfast arrived however it was of a high quality once again. One comment I would make is that we sat in the concervatory for breakfast and it was not very clean (dirty windows and alot of dead flys and dust on the window areas - there realy is no excuse for this).
reviews.title: Very disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I had booked a Superior room in advance. When I checked in I was given a charge card which said that I’d won a complimentary upgrade. On enquiring what type of room I’d been upgraded to I was told they could not upgrade me beyond a Superior room and they wouldn’t offer me the Superior room at the standard bedroom rates. When I expressed my disappointment I was told that the written offer of a complimentary upgrade was a mistake!
reviews.title: Over-rated, over-priced and poor customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The swimming pool at the leisure centre was full of mothers and young children and the only heating in my Superior room was a cold radiator which did not work - when I complained I was given a fan heater. If that’s what Hall Garth has to offer its Superior Room customers, I would hate to be in a standard bedroom.
reviews.title: NICE HOTEL NEEDS REFURBISHMENT THOUGH

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one night room was lovely we had a superior room in the old part of the building. Hotel pool was ok but dated. Food was really nice. Breakfast was good.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from an overnight stay at Hall Garth and it was wonderful. Great value for money. Staff are brilliant and nothing is too much bother for them. Food was lovely in hotel and the service was great. Can recommend having a treatment at the Beauty Rooms as well, Sharon was great and very professional, was a real treat! Our room was beautiful with a four poster bed and everywhere was lovely and clean. Cant find fault with this place at all and love the fact that they tell you the history of the hotel by having a little leaflet in each room, stunning place and cant wait to return some time soon! Thankyou to all the staff, you should be very proud of yourselves.
reviews.title: hidden gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: initial confusion over booking dealt with in friendly and professional manner Room was extremely clean and well appointed ,4 poster bed, fireplace, modern bathroom with even a TV over the bath. Beautiful outlook over the golf course.Had dinner in the hotel and everything was cooked to perfection and the service was friendly ,efficient and unobtrusive.Breakfast was not rushed and the staff happy to met your every need.There was lots of choice and it was delicious.After booking out at 11am we went to the pool for a few hours.This too was well appointed with extensive gym equipment ,sauna steam room and jacuzzi and once again friendly approachable staff and it was so clean.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: At first blush this looked like such a nice place. The hotel was clean and smart, the room was too.
reviews.title: Nice room but soooo noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: However, as I tried to settle down for the night, the people in the next rooms on both sides as well as further down the corridor all had their televisions on, and the walls were so thin you could hear them really clearly. I could not go to sleep. Why cant they make the walls a bit more soundproofed?! Later some teenagers were most rowdy as they returned to their room near mine.
reviews.title: In need of TLC
Nice place
reviews.text: At 4am the next door occupant decided to flush their ensuite toilet, and the noise was so loud it woke me up. The showers have much the same effect. What plumbing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: I was again rudely awakened by the arrival of the early morning staff singing out cheery welcomes to one another just outside my room.
reviews.title: Great value - but......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hall Garth for a weekend and from the moment we checked in we realised what a wonderful place this was going to be. The food was very good and ample portions! Breakfast was wonderful and served in the beautiful conservatory. My husband played golf and I got to relax in the most beautiful lounge. What a find. The rooms were excellent and extremely comfortable. We would visit there again no problems. Staff were very good.
reviews.title: Wonderful weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Wish they would ban mobile phones from the dining room that is the only criticism!
reviews.title: Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: Used this hotel for a business meeting, with evening meal and stop over.
reviews.title: Excellent food and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The meeting facilities were good value and we were looked after through the day being serviced our refeshments on que.
reviews.title: hidden gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: When finished I checked into my room which was all very easy.
reviews.title: Good in parts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have stayed here twice before, both times on business, but this time was a desperatley needed break in what had turned out to be an epic drive from St. Andrews to Cambridge. The first time we stayed we were really impressed with the food, but not so on our second visit. Thankfully Karl has restored the quiality of the food, though still a little ways to go to match Roberts efforts.
reviews.title: Another Fine Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in luck when we stopped in a lay-by to check availabilty to discover a real bargain deal £99 DBB, with a bottle of bubbles and chocolates thrown in. Our luck was definatley in as we were in room 42, a quaint "feature" room off of the staircase, which was idillic and made our decision to break our journey simply magical. We availed ourselves of the pool and sauna, which is a little small if busy as it is also used by private members, but hey it's free!
reviews.title: Nice place but a few irritations spoilt it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is excellent with large portions, (biggest posset I've ever had). though would prefer smaller portions and equisite food, sorry. Wine list is somewhat limited, but adequate. Breakfast as always was first rate, served by the ever friendly and helpful staff.
reviews.title: Idyllic, luxurious getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It maybe a cliche, but the staff do make you so welcome. Keen to please, but repectful of your privacy. The lengths one waiter went to to ensure my wife had earl grey tea, giving her extra tea bags for our room, was endearing......and he makes a demon cup of iced tea he later told us, as we relaxed in the moring sun on the terrace looking up the fairway. \par
reviews.title: a hidden gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: \par
reviews.title: Great value, excellent staff, don't be put off by the website.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hall Garth Hotel in mid-Feb 09 after a booking mix-up by my company (was meant to be staying at The Kings Hotel) and I'm so glad the mix-up occurred.
reviews.title: Beautiful room, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room I stayed in (#1) was beautiful. I was expecting your standard business traveller room, but this room was very large, had period furniture, was decorated beautifully and to top it off a great big four poster bed! The bathroom looked very new and clean, and there was a television built into the wall beside the bath. Luxury
reviews.title: More of a function centre than a hotel

likes.disliked: — room with no heating or soundproofing, poor quality food and way out of town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: On my arrival at the hotel (early evening) it looked as if a new member of staff was being trained, but both trainer and trainee were very pleasant and i was checked in without fuss. Declining the offer of a morning newspaper or wake-up call, I did take advantage of the free wi-fi service.
reviews.title: Disappointing!

likes.liked: — decor in the part we were in

reviews.title: great sound proofing!!!
reviews.text: The hotel is a few miles outside of Darlington town centre, so unless you have a car (i didn't) you're limited to the hotel restaurant or the adjoining 'Stables' pub. I chose Stables as the new trainee on reception advised me they had a new menu on that night. I enjoyed a tasty steak and chips and a pint at a very reasonable price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm coming back down south on business again next week and I'll most certainly be asking them to book me into Hall Garth again. Despite the location the hotel is top class and certainly exceeded my expectations in every way
reviews.title: Perfect weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited the Hall Garth for a spa/gym weekend and for the peaceful surrounds. We were not let down. Very friendly staff in the both the hotel and recreation centre and all the gym, pool and sauna facilities that we were looking for. The spa treatments also couldn't be faulted.
reviews.title: Nice spa/gym break

likes.disliked: — Thin walls in the new rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the newer non-smoking wing of the hotel. The room was modern and spacious, but we agree with the comments in some of the previous reviews that the walls could do with some extra insulation. We could hear clearly the television and conversations of people in the neighbouring rooms, but luckily they went to sleep early.
reviews.title: Take your hot water bottle!

likes.liked: — location, comfy bed, friendly helpful staff
likes.disliked: — no shower in four poster suite and no way of rinsing hair- a bit unacceptable really in this day and age

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall though, a great location, friendly staff and good value for money for a spa/gym break or just a weekend away.
reviews.title: Charming Hotel with lots of facilties

likes.liked: — The food in the restaurant and the beauty room also the leisure centre staff
likes.disliked: — Room a bit tired looking - although comfortable and the filthy bar area - yuck!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We stayed for one night in December as we were attending a Christmas Party Night. We decided to go for a suite as we had a bit of a reduction on the price with going to the party night.
reviews.title: lovely room with excellent clean bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The four poster bed in the room was lovely and very comfy. However, we were very disappointed that there was no shower in the room - I had to rinse my hair with a cup. We did complain though and got some money off. The rest of the furniture in the room was pretty tired and old and the room was absolutely freezing cold - definitely take a hot water bottle if you go in winter!
reviews.title: good nights sleep

aka: Hall Garth Golf And Country Club Hotel Darlington
description: Attractive Georgian Country House with original portions dating from 1540, set in 69 acres of park & woodlands.
